JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr QUANTITY Harutioenyan , Mr PERSON and PERSON Harutioenyan are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively . The first applicant is the father of the second and third applicants . They live in GPE and are represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . In DATE , the applicants fled from GPE to GPE . Allegedly unable to register formally with the authorities there , they managed through bribery of local policemen to reside illegally in GPE until DATE when DATE after the first and second applicant had been briefly held in DATE in a police station in GPE ( GPE ) , where they had been illtreated by policemen – the CARDINAL applicants travelled to the GPE , where they arrived on DATE and applied for asylum .

CARDINAL . The first applicant stated that he had been an active member of an NORP opposition political party . In the campaign for the NORP presidential elections in DATE , the first applicant had actively campaigned for an opposition candidate . After having started these activities in DATE , he had received an anonymous telephone call in which he and his family were threatened if he did not cease his activities . DATE after this call , he had been attacked in the street by CARDINAL unknown men . He had not filed a criminal complaint with the police , but had mentioned it to persons in the party office .

CARDINAL . In the subsequent campaign for the NORP parliamentary elections in DATE , the first applicant had been CARDINAL of the campaign leaders of an opposition candidate , due to which activity the first applicant had received fresh anonymous telephone threats . Furthermore , on an unspecified date at DATE , the first applicant ’s car had been vandalised by CARDINAL unknown persons who had fled in a white car without licence plates . The first applicant had filed a criminal complaint about this incident at the NORP neighbourhood police station in GPE . The first applicant had continued with his political activities . On CARDINAL or CARDINAL May CARDINAL , the first applicant had again received anonymous threats by telephone .

CARDINAL . On DATE at around TIME , after the first applicant had come home from a political meeting where he had given a speech , the applicants’ spouse / mother had gone to the upstairs bedroom where she had been shot and killed by a single shot fired through the bedroom window . The first applicant , who had been downstairs when the shot had been fired , and the second applicant had called an ambulance . The ambulance staff had alerted the police . DATE after his wife ’s funeral on DATE , the first applicant had received an anonymous telephone call . He had understood from that conversation that the perpetrator(s ) had sought to kill him and not his wife and that he risked being killed if he continued with his political activities .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in order to obtain information about the police inquiry into his ORG death , the first applicant had gone to a local police inspector who had treated him with indifference . He had then gone to ORG where he had been refused entry but at the door had spoken with an official who had been called . When the applicant had started to relate what had happened to him , this official had reacted in a very offhand manner .

CARDINAL . In the course of a political meeting held on DATE , the applicant had seized the microphone and in a poignant manner had informed the audience about what had happened to his wife . After he had been accompanied home by the second applicant and a friend , the phone had rung . When the first applicant had picked up the phone , no one had answered . TIME , after the second and third applicant had gone to sleep , the first applicant had heard the sound of breaking glass . When he had checked the cause , he had discovered that fire had broken out in his own bedroom and a guestroom . He and his children had fled outside and after TIME the fire brigade had arrived . The fire brigade had alerted the police , who had questioned the applicants about the origins of the fire and drawn up an official report on the fire . The first applicant was asked to sign a statement drawn up by the police . After having stayed for DATE with a friend , the applicants had left for GPE . Their identity and other official documents had gone missing in the fire in their home .
CARDINAL . The asylum request filed by the second and third applicant was based on their father ’s account .

CARDINAL . After an initial negative decision given on DATE by the Deputy Minister of Justice ( ORG ) had been withdrawn on DATE , the Minister for ORG ( Minister PERSON Integratie ; the successor of the Deputy Minister ) rejected the applicants’ asylum request in CARDINAL new , separate decisions given on DATE . The applicants filed an appeal with ORG ( rechtbank ) of GPE . A hearing was scheduled for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants were informed that the Minister had withdrawn her impugned decisions of CARDINAL DATE . Consequently , the applicants withdrew their appeal pending before ORG of GPE on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the Minister requested ORG to examine the CARDINAL applicants in order to see whether their state of health militated against expulsion . On DATE , ORG drew up and transmitted its advice in respect of each of the applicants to the Minister . It found that all CARDINAL were suffering from mental health problems for which treatment was available in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister informed the applicants of her intention ( voornemen ) to reject their respective asylum requests . On DATE the ORG lawyer submitted written comments ( zienswijze ) on this intended rejection .

CARDINAL . In CARDINAL separate decisions of DATE , the Minister rejected the applicants’ asylum requests . As regards the first applicant , the Minister considered inter alia DATE apart from the fact that his identity , nationality , and travel itinerary had not been substantiated with documents , which detracted from the credibility of his asylum account – it had not been established that the first applicant had attracted the negative attention of the NORP authorities or persons in authority or that the events related in the first applicant ’s account could be linked to such authorities or persons . This allegation was solely based on personal assumptions and suspicions which did not tally with information set out in official country assessment reports ( ambtsberichten ) on GPE drawn up on DATE and CARDINAL DATE by ORG , according to which ORG supporters did not encounter any obstacles in GPE . The Minister therefore found that the first applicant ’s account lacked positive persuasiveness and credibility . The Minister further considered that the medical care in GPE could not be considered to be of such a low standard that , for this reason , the first applicant ’s expulsion should be seen as entailing a real risk of a violation of LAW . The Minister lastly found no reasons of a compelling humanitarian nature that would warrant the issuance of a residence permit . As the asylum requests of the other CARDINAL applicants depended on their father ’s account , their asylum requests were also rejected by the Minister , who did not find that their removal to GPE would entail a real risk of a violation of their rights under LAW on account of their state of health .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed an appeal which was heard on DATE before ORG of The GPE sitting in GPE .

CARDINAL . In its judgment of DATE , ORG of The Hague rejected the ORG appeal . Although it accepted that the first applicant ’s account was coherent and detailed , ORG was not convinced of the alleged impossibility for the applicants to obtain replacement identity documents during their DATE stay in GPE . It concluded that the applicants had not demonstrated that they DATE if expelled to GPE – would be exposed to a real and personal risk of being subjected to treatment proscribed by LAW . If need be , they could seek the protection of the NORP authorities .
CARDINAL . ORG further found no compelling reasons of a humanitarian nature warranting the issuance of a residence permit to the applicants .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ subsequent appeal to ORG ( Afdeling Bestuursrechtspraak ) of ORG ( PERSON ) was dismissed on DATE . It upheld the impugned judgment of DATE . No further appeal lay against this ruling .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the ORG under Rule CARDINAL of ORG to indicate to the Government not to expel them pending the proceedings before the ORG . On DATE the President of the Section decided not to issue the interim measure sought by the applicants .
